t: This*p is the word of the Lord*s that came to the prophet Jeremiah about the Philistines before Pharaoh defeated Gaza.

This is what the Lord*s says: Look,*pn water is rising from the north and*ln becoming an overflowing wadi. It*ln will overflow the land and everything in it, the*ln cities and their inhabitants. The*ln people will cry out, and*ln every inhabitant of the land will wail.

At*ln the sound of the stomping hooves of his stallions, the*ln rumbling of his chariots, and*ln the clatter of their wheels, fathers*ln will not turn back for their sons. They*ln will be utterly helpless

on*ln account of the day that is coming to*ln destroy all the Philistines, to*ln cut off from Tyre and Sidon every*ln remaining ally. Indeed,*ln the Lord*s is about to destroy the Philistines, the*ln remnant of the coastland of Caphtor.
Baldness*ln is coming to Gaza; Ashkelon*ln will become silent. Remnant*ln of their valley, how*ln long will you gash yourself?
Oh,*ln sword of the Lord!*s How*ln long will you be restless? Go*ln back to your sheath; be*ln still; be silent!
How*ln can it rest when*ln the Lord*s has given it a command? He*ln has assigned it against*ln Ashkelon and the shore of the sea.
